items.title: Front-End Integration Engineer at Clicktripz (Manhattan Beach, CA) (allows remote)
items.content:
Clicktripz is looking for a talented front-end developer. This is a full-time
position and the developer would be able to work remotely while communicating
with our office in Manhattan Beach, California.

The ideal candidate is a motivated self-starter who can work creating flexible
solutions that reach the goals and business needs of our customers. This person
must be comfortable assuming ownership of projects and be able to adapt to
changing requirements. 

Please do not apply if you are not located in the United States

Responsibilities

* Integrate ClickTripz products onto some of the largest travel websites in
the world.
* Maintain on-going partner integrations.
* Spec and implement new JS products for the Clicktripz 3rd party suite.
* Kill 10 Mudbelly boards and bring me their pelts... but don't hurt yourself
now!
* Troubleshoot any issues regarding front-end solutions, thinking creatively
on how to implement solutions.
Skills & Requirements

* You have a strong software development fundamentals through your Bachelor's
Degree in CS or have a related degree or experience.
* You have experience building production-level websites, and you have a
solid understanding of the web stack.
* You have an intimate understanding of how browsers work, and have
experience building cross browser functionality.
* You preferably have experience building 3rd party javascript solutions.
* You have great attention to detail, with a meticulous mindset.
* Great communication skills. We are a remote-based company. 
* Sample of code or products you have worked on. Github profile is a plus.
About Clicktripz

Clicktripz believes in an advertising network that’s a win for all parties
involved. Publishers can monetize their website using a fully customizable
ad-widget and receive the highest revenue share in the industry. Live metric
data is freely given and easily accessible through a reporting site.
Advertisers have access to metrics and fine grained targeting. This allows them
to find and purchase the traffic that works best for them. On top of all this,
the Clicktripz team provides support to its customers. This support helps them
be their best, and ensures the network works for them. Clicktripz is a growing
company that started in 2010 with 3 people, today the team has grown to
45 members and is still expanding. The technological back-end runs on a large
scale, serving millions of advertisements per day. The growing workload and
potential business means Clicktripz needs your help. Clicktripz does all work
remotely with a small office in Manhattan Beach, CA. This is a great
environment if you communicate well with the team, are self-driven, and manage
your own time. The combination of a small development team and the steady
addition of new features provides a lot of room to learn and grow.

Joel Test score: 12 out of 12

The Joel Test is
a twelve-question measure of the quality of a software team.

* Do you use source control?
* Can you make a build in one step?
* Do you make daily builds?
* Do you have a bug database?
* Do you fix bugs before writing new code?
* Do you have an up-to-date schedule?
* Do you have a spec?
* Do programmers have quiet working conditions?
* Do you use the best tools money can buy?
* Do you have testers?
* Do new candidates write code during their interview?
* Do you do hallway usability testing? apply now <> more jobs at Clicktripz
<>
Join us at Clicktripz

We have great benefits
Health Insurance 401k Unlimited Vacation Policy Your choice of Computer
Equipment (Laptop + External Monitor) Remote Based Team Company Retreat
Learn more about Clicktripz <> more jobs at Clicktripz

items.title: Integration Consultant - Kronos Incorporated - Home Based
items.content:
<> Integration Consultant
Kronos Incorporated 63 reviews <> - Home Based
Kronos is the global leader in workforce management solutions that enable
organizations to control labor costs, minimize compliance risk, and improve
workforce productivity. Tens of thousands of organizations in 100 countries –
including more than half the Fortune 1000® - use Kronos time and attendance,
scheduling, absence management, HR and payroll, hiring, and labor analytics
applications. Kronos customers include enterprises large and small across
diverse industries worldwide including retail, hospitality, healthcare,
manufacturing, public sector, services, and distribution.

Kronos is a privately held company and was founded in 1977. Headquartered in
Chelmsford, Massachusetts, Kronos employs more than 4,000 people worldwide.

Kronos is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to
maintaining a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants
will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color,
religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national
origin, physical or mental disability, age, or veteran status or any other
basis protected by federal, state, or local law.

Responsibilities:

As part of Global Integration Team you will work with implementation teams
and the integration team to provide support around integration requirements for
Kronos Full Suite.

* Resources will have to be able to communicate clearly and consult with
customers while collectioning and documenting design requirements.
* Work closely with Project Managers and Integration Consultants,
communicating and understanding goals required to complete required tasks on
time and budget.
* Support Customers thru Developement, UAT and Go-Live
* Design, develop, modify, debug and evaluate tools developed to aid the
Professional Service Teams
* Support development with tools and applications in other parts the
professional services organization .
* Exposure to some fairly complex technology environments requiring a
multi-product solution, as well as product integration, solutions.
* Must be comfortable linking database values to our integration module
* Must be comfortable working customers in both a on-premise and cloud based
environments
Qualifications:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each
essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative
of the knowledge, skills and/or ability required.

* 3 to 5 years' experience in a development environment
* Experience utilizing PC application software (MS Office)
* Be self-sufficient/motivated but be able to work as part of a team
* Ability to translate requirements into working solutions
* Demonstrated communication skills – written and verbal (internal and
external facing)
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Computer Science or related field
required
* Travel up to 50%
* Office enviroment, Team focused to foster collaboration between team members
Additional knowledge preferred but not required:

* SQL and/or Oracle Databases
* Development languages (.NET, JAVA, VB, C++, C#, PHP)
* Development tools (for example source control, defect tracking tools, etc.)
* Dell Boomi
* Web Services Development
* Kronos Connect or WIM
#LI-PM1
4 days ago

items.title: Merchant Integration Specialist
items.content:
About us
Founded in 2010, Checkout.com is an international FinTech company providing end to end e-commerce solutions for payments on the Internet. Built on 100% proprietary technology Checkout.com’s online platform offers all credit and debit cards as well as alternative and local payment methods through a single integration. With clients such as Deliveroo, Virgin, Adidas and many more, Checkout.com’s 120+ talented team members serve a list of true tier one global retailers and leading mobile applications from its London, Dubai, Singapore and Mauritius offices.

At Checkout.com we strive to create a unique working environment where each of our employees are empowered to take their responsibilities, solve complex puzzles and deliver value accretive solutions for the Company. We believe an individual maximum yield can only be achieved through a dynamic corporate culture that focuses on personal growth and exciting career development paths.

This experience is offered in a fast paced and innovation-focused office space ideally located in the heart of London.

Summary
Checkout.com is actively looking for a dynamic & motivated Merchant Integration Specialist responsible for providing our merchants and business partners with a world class first and second line support.

The Integration Support Specialist will play a critical role in maintaining the trust of our customers, ensuring that any technical queries that arise during the integration process are answered and escalated when required. Working directly with our customers’ technical teams to resolve issues, a successful candidate will also collaborate closely with various internal stakeholders across Technology and Business to contribute towards consolidating Checkout.com’s position as a leading online payment solutions provider in the region.

The ideal candidate must be customer-driven with strong critical thinking, problem solving abilities and eager to join a dynamic, agile and fast growing environment.

Key Responsibilities
- Provide first and second line support to merchants during their implementation of Checkout payment processing technology
- Answer all merchants’ integration related questions, including but not limited to configuration, debugging, documentation, testing, and go live support
- Manage incidents as related to the integration (investigation, troubleshooting, escalation, resolution, reporting, time tracking and analysis of incidents)
- Partner internally with Business Support, Sales, Software and Web
- Development to resolve issues that arise during customer trials, integrations, or post implementation support
- Advise Management on support issues which impact customer satisfaction and provide recommendations for appropriate actions
- Maintain/update existing libraries/plugins used in integrations

Skills & Experience
- 2-4 years’ experience in FinTech preferred
- Understanding of PHP, JavaScript and .NET appreciated
- Knowledge of WAMP/LAMP stacks
- Experience with Git
- Familiarity of Android and iOS is a plus
- Excellent communication skills, able to build and maintain strong relationships
- Ability to work in a customer focused and target driven environment
- BSc in IT or related fields
- Fluency in English

items.title: Build/Release Engineer at Open Robotics (Mountain View, CA) (allows remote)
items.content:
Develop, extend, and support an extensive and complex build farm that
continually handles thousands of build and test jobs on many architectures and
operating systems. This position would involve close collaboration with
software and build engineers at OSRF and elsewhere to streamline the
build/release process and solve issues as they arise. Join the build/release
team as we expand to bring the flexibility and power of open-source software to
as many computing platforms as possible, while also providing a convenient
end-user binary installation experience.

Skills & Requirements

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

* Develop and support build/release automation on a large-scale build farm
* Manage buildfarm machines, both physical and cloud-based
* Develop and support continuous-integration processes on a variety of
hardware and software architectures
SKILLS / JOB REQUIREMENTS

* Patience and empathy for both upstream software developers and downstream
users, and the ability to effectively communicate this through electronic means
(email, tickets, etc.)
* Degree(s) in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent industry
experience
* Expert level skills in Ruby, Python, bash, CMake, and other scripting
languages
* Extensive knowledge and experience with git, Mercurial, and other source
code management tools
* Extensive knowledge and experience with Docker and Jenkins (or similar
tools)
* Expert-level deployment experience on at least one platform
* Experience in test tools (automated tests, coverage, statistics) for C++,
Python, and/or Ruby
NICE TO HAVE'S

* Experience building and distributing large collections of open-source
software
* Experience in QA
* Cross-platform deployment experience on Linux, Mac OS X, and Windows
* System-administration experience
* Configuration management using puppet, chef, and similar tools
* Experience as a Linux maintainer
APPLICATION MATERIAL

* Cover letter, in which you introduce yourself and explain your interest in
joining our team
* Resume / CV
* Link(s) to sample(s) of your work, ideally in a publicly-viewable location
* Two references and/or two letters of recommendation
About Open Robotics

Open Source Robotics is a subsidiary of the Open Source Robotics Foundation
located in Mountain View, California. We work with
industry to support the development, distribution, and adoption of open source
software for use in robotics research, education, and product development.

Joel Test score: 9 out of 12

The Joel Test is
a twelve-question measure of the quality of a software team.

* Do you use source control?
* Can you make a build in one step?
* Do you make daily builds?
* Do you have a bug database?
* Do you fix bugs before writing new code?
* Do you have an up-to-date schedule?
* Do you have a spec?
* Do programmers have quiet working conditions?
* Do you use the best tools money can buy?
* Do you have testers?
* Do new candidates write code during their interview?
* Do you do hallway usability testing? apply now <> more jobs at Open
Robotics <>
Join us at Open Robotics

We have great benefits
3-weeks vacation Paid maternity and paternity leave Health, dental, and vision
401k with matched contributions Flexible work schedule Personal laptop

Who you’ll work with
Nate Koenig

view profile <> Brian Gerkey

view profile <> Tully Foote

view profile <> Karsten K

view profile <> Carlos Agüero

view profile <> Steven Peters

items.title: Automation Dev (Cloud exp) needed asap at Intergraph UK Ltd - Hostsure (Dublin, Ireland) (allows remote)
items.content:
The Automation Developer is an integral member of the SmartPlant Cloud
Automation team and key to ensuring on time and quality project delivery.
Supporting the other team members and management, the individual will work on a
variety of projects including setup, configuration and testing of automation
framework components, PowerShell module scripting, Workflow analysis and
design, Workflow Scripting as well as assisting in Research and Development
efforts during Proof of Concept phases designed to enhance the Automation
framework. Additionally, the Developer will help coach non-developer team
members to improve their PowerShell Coding and module creation where possible
with a focus on code quality and adherence to team standards.

It is expected that the role will be developed to the individual’s strength’s
and become more specialised over time, particularly where a natural aptitude or
desire is shown towards a specific area or application.

Responsibilities:

* Develop required PowerShell Modules and Azure Automation Runbooks in
accordance with best practices.
* Produce documentation supporting the development lifecycle.
* Contribute to the automation framework and methodology development.
* Support and learn from automation engineers and developers in a variety of
automation workflows.
* Coach non-developer team members in development methodologies and best
practices.
* Attend regular project, team and customer meetings where required.
* Liaise with Microsoft Azure Teams when required to help deploy new features
and enhancements released on the Azure Automation platform.
* Participate in R&D efforts to improve methods, toolsets and processes used
by the automation team.
* Support Automation Workflows and code throughout its lifecycle from
Development to Test/Integration and then into the Production environment.
Intergraph Process, Power & Marine (PP&M) offers challenging work and a global
team environment where your opinion counts. We also offer a competitive
compensation and benefits package including opportunities for professional
development and learning. To learn more about our company visit
http://www.intergraph.com . To view all of our EMIA
region employment opportunities or to apply for this job visit
http://www.intergraph.com/careers/emia/default.aspx


Skills & Requirements

Qualifications:

Educated to degree level or equivalent you will have:

* Previous experience in a DevOps or Automation Development role.
* Ability to develop in a variety of scripting languages
* Knowledge of automation and configuration management technologies (e.g.
Azure Automation, DSC, Chef, Puppet)
* Knowledge of application packaging technologies (e.g. Chocolatey, NuGet)
* Knowledge of Hybrid and Public Cloud infrastructure and technologies.
* Knowledge of Smartplant Applications
* Customer focused with desire for excellent service delivery
* Ability to self-manage and motivate and deliver projects to agreed deadlines
* Flexible working hours.
* Ability to analyse data and make decisions based upon findings.
* Ability to report accurately and succinctly
* An eye for detail and accuracy
* Ability to fit in to a team yet also work alone with minimum supervision.
* Positive outlook and attitude
About Intergraph UK Ltd - Hostsure

Intergraph Process, Power & Marine (PP&M) is the world’s leading provider of
enterprise engineering software enabling smarter design and operation of
plants, ships and offshore facilities.


Intergraph is part of Hexagon (Nasdaq Stockholm: HEXA B; hexagon.com), a
leading global provider of information technologies that drive productivity and
quality across industrial and geospatial applications.

Joel Test score: 9 out of 12

The Joel Test is
a twelve-question measure of the quality of a software team.

* Do you use source control?
* Can you make a build in one step?
* Do you make daily builds?
* Do you have a bug database?
* Do you fix bugs before writing new code?
* Do you have an up-to-date schedule?
* Do you have a spec?
* Do programmers have quiet working conditions?
* Do you use the best tools money can buy?
* Do you have testers?
* Do new candidates write code during their interview?
* Do you do hallway usability testing? apply now <> more jobs at Intergraph
UK <>
Join us at Intergraph UK Ltd

We have great benefits
standing desks healthcare for employee and family incentive plans pension life
assurance reward programme
